resources.string:
How do you quit apps?
Pressing Back always means that you finished your work and wanted to quit.
Pressing Home would start the launcher and kick this app into backiground.

We love this design of Android, but some apps do not. They keep them in backgroud and drain your battery, some even push useless notifications to draw your attention.

And Brevent is going to protect your phone from these apps.
Swiping away from Recent Screen or pressing Back, they would be force-stopped immediately.
Pressing Home and they would be kept in the background to finish their tasks, but not for too long they would be force-stopped, too.

For background apps, Brevent shows the idle time dynamically.

What do I need to do? 
Just a simple command, along with your PC.

Some similar apps require root access or modifying your unlocked device. Debugging mode doesn't require root access, nor unlocking, it's much safer to use. \n\nThere is an experimental ROOT feature, allowing you to skip turning on debugging mode, event start Brevent server when boot completed. You can press Back 7 times on "Please start Brevent service" page, or press "Version" 7 times in "Settings". ROOT mode is unsafe and unnessary, we do not offer support about ROOT mode.
We need debugging mode to launch our Brevent without rooting your device. However, debugging mode is not safe enough, We strongly recommend you turn it off after starting Brevent successfully.
Brevent uses plenty of Android\'s hidden APIs. Some third-party ROMs may modify these API, so there would be some issues when using.
Enjoy Brevent, and feel free to feedback.

The default Brevent method is "App Standby"(since Android 6.0). If you find some apps still running, please use Brevent or other tools to check its status.

And to increase battery performance, Brevent sever delay the processe by 3 to 60 seconds according the event level.

When you clear apps from recent tasks, Android will kill the processes and Brevent would stop them ASAP.

ADB (Android Debug Bridge) is a command-line tool that lets you communicate with an Android device. It\'s part of platform-tools, you can download it from here: https://developer.android.com/studio/releases/platform-tools.html (Long press, then select and copy).

1. uncompress platform-tools-latest-<platform>.zip

2. navigate to platform-tools directory

3. (for Windows) Hold Shift key, then right-click, choose "Open command window here", you can run "adb" now

3. (for Mac OS X) Navigate "Finder", "Applications", "Utilities", open "Terminal", then drag "adb" into the "Terminal" (please remove duplicate "adb" when paste the command line)

1. Turn on "Developer options", enable "USB debugging" %1$s

2. Connect to PC via USB %2$s

3. Execute in PC's command line "adb devices", make sure PC can find device (Reader "Guide - ADB")

4. Execute in PC's command line "%3$s"
Brevent service started successfully. Please click app icons to choose them, and brevent them
Retrieving processes status, just a moment. . .
Update Brevent list when apps installed or uninstalled

Standby when you exit apps (by pressing \"Back\"), or background apps timed out; force-stop when reach standby time out or clear them from Recent Tasks list\n\nAlways force-stop awaken apps have no activity
Standby when you exit apps (by pressing \"Back\"), or background apps timed out\n\nAlways force-stop awaken apps have no activity
Force-Stop when you exit apps (by pressing \"Back\"), or background apps timed out, or clear apps from Recent Task list\n\nBrevent always force-stop awaken apps have no activity
Background apps will be brevented after %s\n\nBrevent shows inactive time for background apps dynamically
Force-stop when apps have standby for %1$s
Thanks for donating %d USD in Play Store

Thanks for donating %1$d times total %2$d USD in Play Store, and priceless contribution on Brevent
Thanks for priceless contribution on Brevent
Including system and framework apps cannot be open\n\nBe careful when breventing system and framework apps
All apps have the same signature with framework\n\nBe careful when breventing system and framework apps
Feel free to feedback.\n\nIf you have a GitHub account, please create an issue; you can view opened issues too.%s
Brevent won\'t force-stop \"Allow Sync\" apps if they pushed notification or running in background\n\nRecommend donate total 1 USD
When checked, allow brevented \"Allow Sync\" apps to receive FCM message\n\nRequires donate total 2 USD for Play version, feel free to donate for other version
When checked, allow ROOT to start Brevent service without "USB Debugging"\n\Requires donate total 3 USD for Play version, feel free to donate for other version
